entry.definition: Assistant Chief Officer - Assistant to the Chief Fire Officer
Assistant Divisional Officer - In charge of a fire station
Automatic Fire Alarm - Automatically sets off when smoke is detected
Standard Name for a Fire Engine
Breathing Apparatus - Face Mask and Oxygen Cylinder, used in smoke filled buildings
A board which is used to keep track of crew using Breathing Apparatus, and air remaining
Chief Fire Officer - Commander of an entire Brigade
Used at large incidents to keep track of appliances attending and planning.
Manufacturer of Fire Helmets, Namely Cromwell 500 (Used until the 90's) Cromwell F500 , Cromwell F600
Divisional Officer - Commands a Division, Takes Charge of Medium Size Incidents
